news uk-news meghan-markles-sister-samantha-vows-"Meghan Markles sister makes shocking claim that she wasnt invited to last wedding because she was in a wheelchairByPatrick Hill:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsSamantha Markle was tonight preparing to launch lawsuits against sister Meghan in the UK and the US. She is claiming the Duchess of Sussex ly briefed about her to the authors of a controversial book. And Samantha is to meet with her legal team again on Monday about the possibility of suing Meghan for “defamation, libel and slander” as well as “breach of privacy”.She told the Sunday People : “I’m speaking to one lawyer in England and one in the US as there are dferent statutory windows and dferent issues.”Samantha, , said she was left in shock on Wednesday when Meghan apologised to the Court of Appeal after emails were disclosed, contradicting a claim that she had not collaborated with the co-authors of biography Finding Freedom.  The messages, revealed by the Duchess’ ex-communications secretary Jason Knauf, show she sent him details about Samantha and brother Thomas Jr, asking him to pass them to writers Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand. Writing in the third person, she also urged him to say that her siblings had “dropped out of high school” and that she had “never had a relationship with either of them”. She added: “Upon Meghan dating Harry, Samantha changed her name back to Markle and began a career creating stories to sell to the press. She had lost custody of all three of her children from dferent fathers.” Meghan has not spoken to Samantha since meeting Prince Harry in . Samantha, who disputes a number of Meghan’s claims, said: “I’m looking at suing for defamation in the US. In the UK, I’m looking at a breach of privacy and data privacy act breach because the statutory window for defamation is only one year in the UK.“Jason Knauf is subpoenable and the messages to [him] are evidence she was libelling and slandering me. Anything to keep this family quiet was my sister’s motto. It’s horrible.”  Wheelchair-user Samantha, who has MS, added: “I’ve never lost custody of any children. She said I changed my name when she met Harry, but I shared my name-change documents long before.” Samantha, who shares the same dad as Meghan, Thomas Snr, said they had a “normal family le” She added: “But she wanted to make us look estranged and separated to discredit us as that was an excuse to keep everybody away from the wedding.”  This week, judges heard Meghan addressed her father as “Daddy” in a letter that would “pull at the heartstrings”it ever became public. Some of her messages were presented as evidence against her claim the letter was purely private. The Mail on Sunday is seeking to overturn a High Court ruling that it unlawfully breached Meghan’s privacy by publishing extracts from it.  Meghan said she had “forgotten” giving Mr Knauf details of what to reveal to Scobie and Durand. Samantha, who has her own book, The Diary of Princess Pushy’s Sister, said: “It shows she’s manipulative.” It comes as Harry and Meghan are believed to be in talks to sign with crisis PR guru Howard Bragman, who has worked with both accusers and accused in the #MeToo movement. A source said: “Bragman is one of the most sought after PRs in the US.” Mr Bragman and the Sussexes did not respond to a request to comment. title: minecraft axolotl craze sees parents
story: Minecraft axolotl craze sees parents warned dont buy disease-carriers for ChristmasAnimal expert begs families to think carefully before getting an axolotl like the cute creatures in Minecraft because they carry disease and are actually quite boringAn axolotl in the Minecraft computer gameByPatrick Hill:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA cute amphibian is on children’s Christmas wish lists this year – but experts warn that axolotls are not the ideal pets they might seem. The photogenic creatures, stars of the video game Minecraft, grow to cm , are rampant breeders, carry disease – and don’t do much . Experts worry that once the novelty wears off, many will be abandoned. Chris Newman, of the National Centre for Reptile Welfare, cautioned: “They’re not the ideal pet for everyone. People shouldn’t buy them thinking they’re going to be like highly interactive cartoon or game console characters – they’re not. “They’re not a hugely challenging animal to look after and they’re quite cute, butI’m being perfectly honest, they’re not the most exciting either – they don’t actually do an awful lot.”  Chris, who notes that they have a lespan of approximately  years, estimates there are already tens of thousands of axolotls in captivity in the UK. And there are fears they could end up being dumped in British rivers and lakes – just as terrapins were following the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles craze of the s. And axolotls, a type of salamander native to Mexico, carry a fungal disease that has made  other species extinct.  Lana Davison, of Southwest Axolotls, said: “Some people only want them because they’re in the game. We have heard of people who have dumped axolotls in lakes.” She added: “They can breed with other things we have already in this country and become an invasive species.” The International Union for Conservation of Nature lists axolotls as critically endangered in the wild. But the amphibians are also bred in home aquariums and science labs around the world, and are widely available on the internet. They sell for anywhere between £ and £. We found one owner in Doncaster offering an axolotl for free, however, because they had “lost interest”. title: mum two 28 kissed boyfriend
story: Mum-of-two, , kissed boyfriend goodbye before he was killed in motorbike crashMum-of-two Amy Emanuel, , said she kissed her boyfriend Michael Maxwell, , goodbye on the morning of August , but hours later he died in a horror motorbike smash in Swansea, WalesMichael Maxwell, , was in a fatal motorbike accident in Swansea at the end of August Image: Amy EmanuelByRhodri HarrisonRyan FaheyReporter:,  Nov | comments A mum-of-two has shared the heartbreaking moment she kissed the love of her le for the last time before he died in a motorcycle accident aged just .Amy Emanuel kissed her partner Michael Maxwell goodbye on the morning of August , but didnapost realise it was the last time she would see him alive.Just hours later Michael tragically died in a motorbike crash in Swansea, leaving behind Amy and his two young children, Wales Online reports. Now Amy, , has shared a tribute to her beloved boyfriend and a warning for others about how quickly le can change in the blink of an eye.Plasterer Mike, who was a master of his trade, left home in Penllergaer that morning to continue developing his business to raise funds to move his family into a brand new home.Amy, who says she will never forget that day, said Mike decided to take his bike to work to enjoy the beautul weather. She told Wales Online: When I found out about an incident involving a motorbike, I immediately rang him and just knew it was him, I didn’t want to believe it and it’s hard to explain how I felt but my heart felt empty, I just knew. The pain, the heartache, feeling numb, disbelief, you don’t want to believe it and you think it will never happen to you, I still don’t want to believe it, he was so young and we just started le as a family - that’s what hurts the most. The family were expecting to move into a new home, but were unable to after Mikeaposs sudden passing. Amy said Mike was such a loving, affectionate partner, my best friend. He was a fun-loving dad to his two kids, Ayla and Zion, and his face would light up every time he would see them. Amy says itaposs heartbreaking to see the kids growing up and Mike isnapost here to see that. I am so grateful he gave us two beautul children that will live on his name forever, she said. Amy and her two children are now moving into a new home. But a tragic milestone is looming as Zion looks forward to his first birthday, but without his father. Ayla does ask to see her daddy and I have to explain heaposs not coming home which is the hardest thing I have had to do in my le, Amy said.  She said: She [Ayla] knows her daddy loves her very much and wishes he could be here and is looking down on her every day. Amy said her friends and family have given an overwhelming amount of support as have people in the community who knew Mike. I am so grateful to every single person, not just for me but our family. After Mike passed we have come together as a family and I think Ayla and Zion have played a massive part in that, they certainly keep everyone busy. Through all this heartbreak, Amy wants to raise awareness that le can suddenly change for anyone. Mike was such a positive person and that was the way to be in le, he taught me to be positive and I’m going to carry that on in his memory, times like this you have to be positive. Don’t get me wrong, I cry every day, I just miss him so much, but it’s ok to cry, it’s ok to be sad. If I’ve learnt anything it’s to be in the present rather than the future because le can change in a blink of an eye. Be grateful for every second that you get to spend with the people you love. Le is so very precious.Friends and family have been raising funds to support Mikeaposs young family during this dficult time. Among the events is a -hour marathon over Pen Y Fan mountain.To support their fundraiser you can do so by clicking here.Comment MORE ON LoveAccidentsCar crashesRoad Traffic Accidents" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-charles-birthday-photo-nightmare-"Prince Charles marks his th birthday with garden party at Buckingham PalaceByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsItaposs Prince Charlesaposs birthday today - and the heir to the throne turns -years-old. This year his birthday coincides with Remembrance Sunday and he will be at the Cenotaph in Central London with the rest of the royals to lead the nation in commemorations. Three years ago he celebrated his landmark th birthday and several gorgeous pictures of him surrounded by his we the Duchess of Cornwall, sons Princes William and Harry and daughters-in-law the Duchesses of Cambridge and Sussex were released. However, stealing the show in the lovely images were his three grandchildren who were born at the time - Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis.  And while fans loved the family shots, it was reportedly an absolute nightmare to arrange as William and Harry made very little effort, a book claims. In their bombshell biography Finding Freedom, authors Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand claim that the royal brothers can be hot and cold with their father. The authors write: The boys can be hot and cold with their fatherapos disclosed a source, who gave the example of planning the photo session for Charlesapos th birthday, which they called aposan absolute nightmareapos.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Neither William nor Harry made much of an effort to make themselves availableapos, the source said. Two photos from the photoshoot were released, the first a more formal snap and the second a candid picture which shows the family laughing.  Since that day, Harryaposs relationship with his father seems to have deteriorated and he has been quite outspoken about the fractured relationship with Charles. During a bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey, Harry accused his dad of refusing to take his calls and claims he cut him off financially. Harry has also appeared on the Apple TV series The Me You Canapost See, where he spoke about the royalsapos total neglect and the Armchair Expert podcast, where he lashed out at Charlesaposs parenting. However, his bond with William seems to have strengthened and most recently Charles spoke of his pride in his eldest son for starting the Earthshot Prize, which he has launched to encourage innovative ideas to save the planet. Charles said: “I am very proud of my son, William, for his growing commitment to the environment and the bold ambition of the Earthshot Prize. “As a world, we need to come together to inspire, reimagine and build the sustainable future we so desperately need. title: prince harry contacted psychic ask
story: Exclusive: Prince Harry contacted Princess Dianas psychic to ask what happened to herPrince Harry contacted the psychic and asked What do you think about how my mother died  as well as asking about his bruv Prince William according to revelations in new bookHarry meets psychic Sally at the fancy dress do at Kensington Roof GardensByHalina WattsSunday Showbiz Editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsPrince Harry contacted a ­psychic used by his late mother to ask for a reading in a bid to deal with his grief, it is claimed. Sally Morgan, who was Princess Diana’s spiritual guide, met Harry when he was seven during a visit to Kensington Palace.And as our exclusive picture reveals, they were reunited at a swanky fancy dress party where Harry rushed up to her saying: “You knew my mother.” Sally, who started her career telling futures for free but can now charge £, a session, claims: ■ She predicted Diana’s tragic end ■ She knew that Harry would marry a brunette ■ And she foretold the couple would stay together despite going through a “tempestuous time”. Sally also claims she still receives messages from beyond the grave, where Diana watches over her sons. Diana died aged  alongside partner Dodi Fayed in a  car crash in Paris. It was around  years later that Harry called Sally to ask: “What do you think about how my mother died ”  He also asked her concerned ­questions about his “bruv” Prince William – as well as what colour hair his future we would have. Sally, , recalls how she met the adult Harry at the fancy dress do at Kensington Roof Gardens around . “He was there dressed in medical scrubs,” she said. “He wouldn’t have any ­photographs taken and he came over to me and said, ‘Sally, you’re the lady who used to see my mother’. “I said, ‘Yes I did. The last time I saw you, you were about seven’. “And he said, ‘Oh, Sally, I remember, my mother would often talk about you, she spoke to you a lot’. “I said that she did and then he askedI wanted a picture. “He was with a group of lads and they were all tipsy, and I remember he bought everyone a round of drinks. It was a fun party.”  But it wasn’t until eight years ago that Sally received a phone call from Harry asking for a reading. They spoke for  minutes in what Sally believes was his first attempt to get to grips with his mental health, which he has since publicly spoken about many times. Sally said: “I was on holiday in St Tropez and he called me and the first thing he said was, ‘What do you think about how my mother died ’.” She says she told him to speak to Diana’s elder sister, Lady Sarah McCorquodale, because “she will tell you what I told her before your mother passed away”. Sally claimed: “I had spoken to Sarah before Diana’s death and had made a prediction the Queen was going to die, that she was in a really dark place and I could see a pavement. “I said they are going to drag her out and give her CPR and she is going to have a heart attack. That is what the Princess of Wales died of, a heart attack. I said a week later the Queen Mother will die because I can see her funeral. Well the Princess of Wales had the Queen Mother’s funeral that had been arranged because they had all their funerals arranged, and Diana took that. I didn’t tell Harry that though, I just told him to speak to his aunt.”  Following Diana’s death, Sarah questioned Sally about her prediction. Sally said: “After Diana died, Sarah said, ‘Well, you said the Queen’. “But I predicted that before she did the interview with Martin Bashir, where she said, ‘I want to be known as the Queen of Hearts’.” During the call with Harry, they also discussed his fears for his brother and who his own future we would be.  “How is my bruv going to be  Is he going to be OK ” she says Harry asked. Sally said she replied: “Of course he is. He will be good and he will be king, but he is in a dferent bubble to you.” She said he replied: “That is why I am always going to worry about him”. At that point Harry was still a bachelor, had dated mainly blonde women and was on off with Cressida Bonas.  But Sally says she told him he would marry someone very dferent. She said: “One of the sweetest things he said to me was, ‘What colour hair will my future we have  Will she have blonde hair ’ I said he would marry someone with dark hair.” Sally believes that their conversation was a prelude to “him waking up to his own mental health” struggles. It wasn’t until  that Harry spoke publicly about it but he has since then championed the ­subject for others.  He admitted to years of attacks both of panic and rage, disclosing that his le was in “total chaos” for two years. In her new book, Secret Spirit, Sally praises Harry’s openness, of which Diana “would have been very proud”. She says the princess told her “as a royal, you were expected to brush those kinds of feelings under the carpet”. “Harry and Meghan are helping drive the debate forward,” Sally added. Despite her le being very dferent to Harry’s, Sally can relate to his “awful” grief – she lost husband John in September, aged . They were married for  years and together for . Now, Sally is helping others with bereavement with John being her guiding light in the spiritual world. And she believes no matter what lies ahead for them Harry, , and Meghan,  – who have kids Archie, two, and Lilibet, five months – will “be together forever”, adding: “Harry will never abandon his children.”For details on Sally’s services visit sallymorgan.tv. Secret Spirit is on shelves November .Sallyaposs book Secret Spirit is available to buy from Amazon: https:www.amazon Secret-Spirit-Sally-Morgan dp  Kindle edition: https:www.amazon dp BDFRQXW ref_pe__ Waterstones: https:www.waterstones book secret-spirit sally-morgan  Comment MORE ON Prince HarryPrince WilliamPrincess DianaRoyal FamilySunday People" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: queen entering new phase reign
story: Queen entering new phase of reign as -year-old monarch suffers fresh setbackThe royal author Penny Junor has suggested the Queen is entering a new phase of her -year reign, during which she will not be seen as much in publicThe Queen may now spend less time in public - and take advantage of technology such as the monarch did with her COP speech Image: Buckingham Palace via Getty ImagesByLaura Elston:,  Nov | comments The nationaposs anxiety over the Queenaposs health will be heightened as the monarch suffered another setback and missed the Remembrance Sunday service, a royal author has saidPenny Junor suggested the Queen is entering a new phase of her reign, during which she will not be seen as much in public. Ms Junor said: Itaposs very sad for the Queen because this is the one event in the year that she really, really likes to be at. Remembering the war dead is a very, very important part for her annual calendar. The public will be very sad and anxious to hear of yet another setback but clearly she must follow the advice and get herself well. The Queen has been under doctorsapos orders to rest for more than three weeks after spending a night in hospital for preliminary tests.  Buckingham Palace had said it was her firm intention to be at the Cenotaph, and announced on Thursday that she would be at the ceremony. But on Sunday morning, less than two hours before she was due to arrive, the Palace said she had sprained her back and could no longer attend. Ms Junor said: Itaposs not surprising because she is  years old. Weaposre so used to seeing her out and about and looking years younger than she is that I think weaposve been lulled into thinking she can go on at this kind of pace forever. Clearly she canapost. There comes a time in everybodyaposs le when they have to admit that they are getting older and canapost do the things that they perhaps want to do.  Suggesting it appears to mark a new phase in the Queenaposs reign, Ms Junor said: I think we will see more of her on video and probably less of her in the flesh. They should keep her warm and tucked up at home and not exposing herself to the possibility of infections. Joe Little, managing editor of Majesty magazine, said: There are shades of the time her mother was a similar age and things got progressively more dficult. But the Queen Mother soldiered on and there is no reason to think the Queen wonapost, but this is a setback. Clearly there are mobility issues. Getting from Windsor with a sprained back and having to stand for  to  minutes at the Cenotaph is not helpful for somebody of .  Mr Little said the Queenaposs calendar in late November and December is traditionally less public-facing with more behind-the-scenes events. The Queen usually also hosts a lunch for her wider family the week before Christmas. You would hope there would be a pre-Christmas family lunch for the extended family, hopefully at Windsor, Mr Little said. That would be a display of normality as far as the Queen is concerned. But in terms of official engagements before the end of the year, I donapost think we will see her out and about doing anything officially, evenshe recovers from the sprained back. title: queens first christmas without philip
story: Queens first Christmas without Philip and four loyal staff by her side at SandringhamThis year marks the Queens first Christmas without her late husband the Duke of Edinburgh, who died, aged , at Windsor Castle in AprilPrince Philip died, aged , in April this year Image: Tim Graham Getty ImagesByKatie Mansfield:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments The Queen faces her first Christmas without Prince Philip this year - and she will also reportedly be left without four loyal members of staff who have left Sandringham.Courtiers have said itaposs the end of an era after a housekeeper with  years of service retired, with three other employees also quitting in the space of two months. This year marks the Queenaposs first Christmas without her late husband the Duke of Edinburgh, who died, aged , at Windsor Castle in April. The Queen has spent every Christmas at Sandringham House since her father’s death in .Christmas is the busiest time of year at Sandringham with the Royal Family all travelling to the Norfolk estate for the festive period beginning with a traditional dinner on December th in the main house.But this year will be slightly dferent as the royals gather for their first Christmas without Prince Philip, who the Queen called her strength and stay in a rare tribute marking their th wedding anniversary in .A source told the Mail on Sunday: There’s been an exodus. There’s an end-of-an-era feeling after the Duke passed away. The household will have to fill those roles quickly as Christmas is the busiest time of year at Sandringham.  The Queen, , has been surrounded by loyal aides as she rests on doctorsapos orders in recent weeks .Dresser Angela Kelly and courtier Paul Whybrew are said to be a source of support for the Queen amid mounting concerns for her health.It comes as the Queen is also looking to hire a new security expert at Buckingham Palace.  Just three months ago the job was advertised as a one year contract with a salary of £, for -and-a-half-hours a week. Now the pay has been increased by % to £, a year. On Christmas Day morning in previous years, the Queen was pictured with Prince Philip and senior members of the Royal Family walking to church before greeting wellwishers. Three-year-old Prince Louis is expected to take part in the annual family event for the first time.William and Kateaposs youngest child may now be three but he has had less exposure to public events than his siblings and what is normal for royal children due to Covid. But on Christmas Day this year he is now ready to attend a service at St Mary Magdalene Church along with the rest of the Royal Family. Prince William and the Duchess of Cambridge usually stay at their nearby Anmer Hall residence over Christmas, as other members of the Royal Family gather at the main house on the Sandringham Estate.  Itaposs thought the Queen has also extended an invitation to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, who stepped down from royal duties last year and moved to the United States.The -year-old monarch is yet to meet her great-granddaughter Lilibet, who was named after her, and is said to be keen to see great-grandson Archie again. A source close to the family said: The Queen has made it clear she wants to see Archie again and to meet Lilibet, who she has not yet had the chance to meet. In spite of everything, they are still very much seen as part of the family. title: royal british legion settle debate
story: Royal British Legion settle debate on how to wear a poppy for Remembrance SundayIf youve seen the debate on whether there is a correct way to wear a poppy to mark Remembrance Sunday but wonderingyouve got it on right  Well heres everything you need to know about the symbol of remembranceMillions of the flowers are produced each year Image: South Wales Evening PostByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsAhead of Remembrance Sunday this weekend, thousands of people are donning a ceremonial poppy. Millions of the flowers are produced each year - with funds going to support the Royal British Legion, who support serving members and veterans of the British Armed Forces and their families. Figures including the Queen, politicians and members of the armed forces will gather to pay their respects at the Cenotaph, while services will take place across the country. The poppies serve as a visible tribute to those who sadly died in WWI and other conflicts since. But there is an ongoing debate over the moving gesture, with people distracted over whether the poppy can be worn aposincorrectlyapos.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Each year, social media is filled with discussion over where it should be worn on the chest, and which way the leaf should be pointing. But the truth is that there is no wrong or right way - as the Royal British Legion has confirmed following debate. The organisation previously said: There is no right or wrong way to wear a poppy. It is a matter of personal choice whether an inidual chooses to wear a poppy and also how they choose to wear it.From paper poppies to pins, bag charms to pet poppies, and now on face masks, the best way to wear a poppy is simply with pride. The British Legion started the now-annual poppy appeal in  - inspired by the poem In Flanders Fields, which refers to flowers growing on the graves of soliders.In Flanders fields the poppies blow Between the crosses, row on row American academic Moina Michael was inspired by the poem and conceived the idea of wearing them as a symbol of remembrance. In the UK, the appeal was a huge success and raised more than £, - a huge amount of money at the time, which could help support veterans. with employment and housing. The following year a poppy factory was set up, employing disabled ex-servicemen, to manufacture poppies and still does so today. To find out more about Remembrance Day, the Royal British Legion or to buy a poppy, click here. title: tiny one room house size
story: Tiny one-room house the size of a garage on sale for £K - and it needs refurbishingThe small property, located in Cha, west London, boasts a bedroom, bathroom and reception room, with the tiny kitchen area including a sink and nothing The one-room property is on the market for £, Image: Google MapsByCharlie Lawrence-JonesSam TrueloveNews reporter:,  Nov | commentsA tiny home the size of a garage is on the market for £,. The small property is  meters by . meters and is described as a excellent rental investment, as well a unique property.The aposhouseapos is located on Stewartaposs Grove in Cha, west London and apparently boasts a bedroom, bathroom and reception room, according to the listing. When looking at the floorplan, the only kitchen amenities in the aposhouseapos are a sink, reports MyLondon. There is a toilet, shower and second sink in the bathroom, however. The whole area is . sq. metres, around the size of a garage. Thereaposs no garden, front or back, with the only way in or out a door straight off the pavement.  The listing also reminds prospective buyers that the property needs refurbishment. The property description reads: A unique, freehold studio located in the heart of Cha. This ideally located property has the potential to be a fantastic London home or rental investment. Stewarts Grove is situated between the Kingaposs Road and Fulham Road. Cha Green, St Lukeaposs Gardens and South Kensington are all within walking distance. The property has been painted using bright colours, although the £, price tag may put some buyers off.Outside of London, that kind of money can get you a five bed detached house in Sheffield. Or in France,you were thinking grander, for £, you could get yourself a chateaux.Comment MORE ON House prices" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: what different coloured poppies mean
story: What do the dferent coloured poppies mean  Red, purple, white and black meaningWhile red poppies are a signicant symbol of Remembrance Day and Remembrance Sunday, you might see dferent coloured poppies being worn as well. Here’s what they each meanBesides the red poppy, youll see white, black and purple poppies being worn Image: REUTERSByMalvika Padin:,  Nov | commentsEvery year on November , people around the UK observe Remembrance Day or Armistice Day marking the day that the agreement which ended the First World War was signed. The Sunday closest to the th - which is November  this year - is observed as Remembrance Sunday, a day of memorial where the nation reflects and remembers the lives lost to war. The day is marked by memorial services, most notably at the Cenotaph in Whitehall, wreath-laying and observing a two-minute silence. People are also seen wearing red poppies throughout the Remembrance period, from the end of October to Remembrance Sunday.  While red poppies are most common, you might also see purple, black and white poppies being worn. Each colour has a dferent meaning about remembering the war. Red poppies During Remembrance, youaposre likely to see thousands of volunteers selling red paper poppies on the streets and in shops. The red poppy is considered a symbol of remembrance, not just of those who died in the World War I, but in conflicts before and since.  Sold by the Royal British Legion, the origin of the red poppy is from a poem written by Canadian officer John McCrae, first published in December , titled In Flanders Fields. The poem describes how poppies grew from the the graves of soldiers on the fields. White poppies White poppies are considered a pacist symbol of remembrance for the war. Distributed by the Peace Pledge Union , white poppies are said to describe three things: remembrance for all victims of war, commitment to peace and a challenge to the glamorisation of conflict. It intends to commemorate all victims of all wars – both military and civilians of all nationalities. But critics claim that white poppies undermine the message of red poppies and Armistice Day. Purple poppiesIntroduced in  by Animal Aid, purple poppies are less common and remember the animals that lost their lives at war. The appeal was begun by the charity because it felt that animals that die at war - mostly horses, donkeys and dogs - are often forgotten. The purple poppy was then replaced with a purple paw badge in . Black poppies The most recent addition to the dferent colours, the black poppy which was launched in  is worn to remember black, African, Caribbean and Pacic Islanders who lost their lives at war.  Distributed by the Black Poppy Rose, black poppies are described as a symbol that signies pride, honour and glory, with the hope that future generations will be inspired by these largely untold historical legacies”. news uk-news what-queen-royal-family-typically-"The Queen arrives at Sandringham for Christmas Day serviceByMirror:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsAs the festive season begins, a team of people at the Queen’s Sandringham estate will undoubtedly be revising the Royal Family’s holiday schedule and Christmas day menu. And while the monarchs may be expected to be dining on everything from caviar to foie gras on the big day, a former palace chef has revealed the Christmas meal he served up couldn’t have been more traditional.It will be the first festive holiday in years that the Queen has sat down to a Christmas dinner without Prince Phillip, who passed away on April , aged . The late Duke of Edinburgh spent four nights in King Edward VIIaposs hospita l in central London receiving treatment for a pre-existing condition from December  in , prompting concerns he would miss out on a family Christmas.However, he was discharged at .am on Christmas Eve, allowing him to head back to Sandingham to spend Christmas with Queen Elizabeth. And on Christmas Day in , The Duke of Edinburgh was away from home on a voyage around the Commonwealth. The Queen remained at Sandringham House, where she has spent every Christmas since her father’s death in . The Royal Family’s traditional Christmas celebrations at Sandringham House are back on this year, after the Queen and Prince Philip spent the day apart from their loved ones last year for a Covid-safe affair. A former palace chef has previously spilled the beans on what their festive meal might entail describing a traditional, but fairly lavish, Christmas feast.Darren McGrady, who used to work in the royal kitchens, said the family was likely to dine on a big lunch after church, which would feature “a salad with shrimp or lobster, and a roasted turkey, and all of your traditional side dishes like parsnips, carrots, Brussels sprouts, and Christmas pudding with brandy butter for dessert”. Theyaposre actually boring when it comes to festivities. They didnapost do hams or anything, just traditional turkeys. “We did three turkeys for the Queen and her family in the royal dining room, one for the childrenaposs nursery and then more for the  or so staff, so everyone had a Christmas lunch. McGrady went on to add: “The turkey is served with mashed and roast potatoes, chestnut or sage and onion stuffing, cranberry sauce and bread sauce. Vegetables include brussels sprouts, carrots and roast parsnips.”  A traditional homemade Christmas pudding is served after the main meal and is “decorated in holly, doused in brandy, and the palace steward would carry it, flaming, into the royal dining room,” says McGrady. Mr McGrady claimed the family stuck with the same meal “year after year”. However, last year Mike Tindall gave a dferent account. Speaking on his rugby podcast last year, he said the royals do much of their festive celebrating on Christmas Eve, and give their staff Christmas Day off. Christmas Day is a little more quiet because itaposs actually a cold buffet because they give everyone the day off, and their big day is Christmas Eve,” he said. While a festive tipple would usually be considered a must on the big day, it is unclear whether the monarch will be enjoying a wine, or a gin this year, following on from reports she has been advised to go teetotal. The Queen, who has recently used a walking stick for the first time on royal visits, is said to be recovering after she had tests and spent a night in hospital last month. However, the Mirror exclusively revealed earlier this month how the Queen was “totally committed” to hosting the festive holidays for all her extended family again this year.A source said: “Her Majesty is very much looking forward to hosting her family at her Norfolk home for the Christmas holiday and there is much preparation to be done in time to accommodate everyone who has been invited. “The Queen has many happy memories of being at Sandringham with the family over Christmas.It was not yet known whether Prince Harry and Meghan Markle would be making their way over from the United States for the occasion.Comment MORE ON The QueenChristmasRoyal FamilyChristmas dinner" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman 32 who thought too
story: Woman, , who thought she was too young for cancer has breasts and oies removedEmma Hughes found a lump in her right breast and it was the start of a long and traumatic journey for her - she has spoken about the moment she was diagnosed and her journey afterwardsMum-of-two Emma Hughes, , is supporting the Stand Up To Cancer campaign Image: Matthew HorwoodByMark Smith:,  Nov | comments A young woman has bravely opened up about being diagnosed with cancer and having to have her breasts and oies removed. At the age of , mum-of-two Emma Hughes thought she was too young to have cancer, Wales Online reports. But after finding a lump in her right breast she decided to go to her GP just to be cautious. It was the start of a long and traumatic journey for Emma who not only needed both breasts removed, but also both oies which brought on early menopause. Emma is sharing her story to support the Stand Up To Cancer campaign in Wales. I ignored it for a while, but eventually went to my GP when it didnapost go away and seemed asit might be getting bigger, recalled Emma, who first saw her doctor in . The GP assured me it was probably nothing because of my age, but did refer me to the breast clinic where after being examined I was given an ultrasound. When they did another in my armpit area and said they wanted to take biopsies I began to worry, although at  I still did not think it could be cancer.  Emma said she was taken into a room and askedshe could come back the following Friday to discuss her results. I brought my sister with me when I came back to be given the devastating news that I had breast cancer which had spread to my lymph nodes, she said. It was a complete and utter shock and my sister was in tears. I felt guilty for putting her through this, at the same time thinking I was going to die and worrying about my sons.I had such an intense feeling of guilt that I had waited before going to the doctor to get the lump sorted, and I was scared.I then had a lot of scans and blood tests to see what kind of cancer it was. It was a relief to find it was still at stage three and not spread anywhere .Sharing the news with her two sons Iestyn, , and Bailey, , was dficult for Emma, now .My younger son has autism and profound learning dficulties - he is non-verbal. But my eldest, who was  at the time, is quite grown up and took it very well when I told him, with the support of the family care nurse, that I had cancer. We gave him a child-friendly book to explain everything, and I made it clear to him I was never going to give up fighting it.The boysapos father helped take care of the kids, even though we are not still together, and social workers helped me get respite care. I also had my sister, mum, dad and friends around me who were all fantastic. Emma had six rounds of chemotherapy and  sessions of radiotherapy. As a preventative measure, she also had her breasts and oies removed.She said: I lost all my hair, including my brows and lashes, and felt exhausted and sick. My treatment was finished by the end of June, , and my oncologist called me in to discuss preventative treatment. My cancer was hormone-based so he suggested removing my oies.In October I had the operation, and in February, , I had a double mastectomy with reconstruction as a further preventative measure. It was a good thing I did, as pathology after the operation showed traces of cancer the size of a grain of sand, although they had not shown up on a CT scan prior to surgery.I am now on Letrozole which makes me a bit tired and achy and I will have to stay on for  years.Emma, from Blackwood, described how her cancer diagnosis led to positive changes in her le. She said: Since the end of my cancer treatment I have gone from strength to strength, in spite of the oy removal putting me into early menopause which gave me hot flushes and panic attacks which I realise, having had counselling before my operation, are just hormonal.I have lost three stone, left my job at a call centre and am training as a nurse. I have turned my le around and have a new outlook. I no longer take anything for granted and try to appreciate all the little things. I realise health is wealth you can have everything, butyour le is on the line, nothing  matters.Emma is backing the Stand Up To Cancer campaign in Wales, the joint fundraising effort from Cancer Research UK and Channel , and is calling on everyone to stand united against the disease by raising money to accelerate le-saving research.Itaposs thanks to research and treatment that I’m still standing and can look forward to a future full of special moments with my loved ones, she added.In Wales, around , people are diagnosed with cancer every year. Stand Up To Cancer helps to take breakthroughs from the lab and transform them into cutting-edge treatments that could help save the lives of more people like Emma. To donate or fundraise, visit suc.org.uk Emma added: With charities having been hit so hard by the pandemic, it feels more important than ever for everyone to do what they can. So, I hope people in Wales will stand up for me and everyone affected by this devastating disease. The campaign, now in its ninth year in the UK, has raised more than £m, funding  clinical trials and projects involving over , cancer patients across the country. These include the development of new treatments that use viruses to fight cancer, clinical trials testing potentially more effective ways to deliver radiotherapy and improved surgical techniques for bowel cancer. Ruth Amies, Cancer Research UK spokeswoman for Wales, said: We are very grateful to Emma for helping us to continue our mission. One in two of us will get cancer in our letime, but all of us can play a part to help beat it. By raising vital funds, supporters could make a real dference to people like Lizzy. Every penny will go directly to our le-saving research, helping our tireless scientists to develop tests and treatments for those who need them most. If we all stand together, we can save lives. title: woman pulled aside boss told
story: Woman pulled aside by boss and told she cant use office microwave for breakfastThe woman, who says her job "requires a lot of concentration, "says her line manager recently pulled her to one side to let her know her behaviour "had been noticed"" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Woman-using-a-microwave.jpg" width"" "" The woman shared the scenario on MumsnetImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByKate LallyDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Nov  A woman claims she was pulled aside at work and told by her boss she is not allowed to use the staff microwave to warm her breakfast up.The woman, who works full time and says her job requires a lot of concentration and is computer-facing all day says her line manager recently pulled her to one side to let her know her behaviour had been noticed.She says she was told that the microwave and toaster were only for lunch breaks, unless she decided to split her break over both, the Liverpool Echo reports. Posting on Mumsnet, the woman wrote: I canapost eat first thing in the morning so I have always eaten mid-morning, at my desk, sometimes something cold, sometimes something that needs a minute or two in the staff microwave.Past employers have never had an issue with this. Iaposm fairly new to this job but in the past two months, no-one has ever raised it as an issue. We have access to a microwave and toaster so sometimes Iaposll bring in a tub of beans, or eggs that Iaposve already put in a bowl and whisked at home so it takes  minutes in the microwave to heat them.  All during the space of time it takes me to make my first cup of tea of the day - which is taken after having already put in - hours work since I got in that morning. All of a sudden my line manager took me aside and said aposit had been noticedapos that I was heating up my breakfast and that I was no longer to do this as it was in work time, that the microwave and toaster were only for lunch breaks, unless I decided to split my break over both. The woman continued: This seems ridiculous to me as it takes max  minutes and I then bring it back to eat at my desk whilst working. I have seen colleagues gone for much much longer than thisthey get into social conversation with colleagues. Also, this instruction was directed only to me, not the team or department as a whole, so it feels very personal. The woman said is important to take regular breaks throughout the day. She added: Am I being unreasonable here  Do others do this at work with no issue  As I said, past employers have never had issue with it and I donapost take the p*** with it. One mum said the woman wasnapost being treated like an adult. She continued: It annoys me when a workplace doesnapost treat people like adults. So I would probably sweetly say aposOkay thataposs fine, Iaposll take the five minutes out of my lunch hour and just have a  minute lunch breakapos. I imagine smokers take up much longer out of their day to have smoke breaks. Others thought the woman was in the wrong. One mum wrote: Beans egg on toast is taking the p*** and stinks the office out. Iaposve never, ever seen anyone at work have more than a bowl of cereal or a yogurt. You are being unreasonable - and cheeky. Another said: I used to have a colleague who did this and it annoyed me so much. While she was stirring up her porridge and blowing it to cool it down, she couldnapost properly perform tasks. She could only type with one hand, often couldnapost answer the phone as she was chewing. It would take her longer to so a simple email or input some data while she was eating than it would normally, and while this was only for - minutes per day, it was every day and very annoying. Also microwave eggs stink. title: women who left boyfriends each
story: Exclusive: Women who left boyfriends for each other give birth to brother and sister from same dadMothers Zoe and Holly Anderson Ross, who fell pregnant at the same time via DIY sperm insemination, are “over the moon” with their cute new arrivals Little Elijah John and Olivia EvaHolly cradles Olivia, left, as Zoe holds little Elijah Image: Adam Gerrard   Sunday MirrorByKelly Jenkins:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsTwo women who ditched their boyfriends to be with each other have both had a baby – via the same sperm donor. The cute tots, a boy and a girl, are biological half-siblings. Little Elijah John and Olivia Eva share a room with their mums Zoe and Holly Anderson Ross, who are “over the moon” with their new arrivals. Holly, who gave birth to Olivia on October , said: “We are so happy and relieved they are here with us and they’re both healthy and perfect. “It’s taken a long time to get here, so it’s a massive relief. Our ­family is now complete. They both feel like both of our babies. It’s not like Olivia is mine because I gave birth to her and Elijah is Zoe’s because she gave birth to him. They are both equally our ­children and they are both so loved.”  The couple, of Hailsham, East Sussex, were dating male pals when they met at a party and experienced an ­irresistible “instant attraction”. At first they dismissed their boyfriends’ suspicions that they fancied each other. But the truth finally came out and Zoe and Holly got together in . They married four years later, with Holly becoming a second mum to Zoe’s daughter Shannon, now .And they told their remarkable story in an interview with the Sunday People seven years ago. Since then they have been trying for a family but suffered three ­miscarriages. Joy finally came when they fell pregnant at the same time via DIY insemination. Zoe, , who had Elijah by Caesarian ­section, said: “It took a long time to get to this point, with two little cherubs in our home. “After trying for so long, we almost gave up. But then we decided to double our chances by both getting inseminated. The next month we fell pregnant to the same donor – it was like fate.”  The sperm donor does not want to be involved with the babies but he is happy for them to contact him when they turn . And the pair’s former boyfriends are no longer in their lives. Holly, also , said: “I imagine our exes will be indferent when they hear we’ve had babies. It wasn’t nice for them when we met and fell in love. “So I don’t imagine they’ll think much of us having kids together.” While barely four weeks since Eliljah arrived on October , both tots are already in a happy routine. Holly added: “Elijah is the more vocal of the two while Olivia is quieter – they’re both quite laidback.  “We’re very lucky. The first week after bringing them home was a total whirlwind of feeding, changing ­nappies and trying to sleep for the odd hour or two before attending to the babies again. “When one slept, the other was awake and vice-versa. “It’s like having twins. It’s total luck of the draw who gets the dirty nappies and who feeds the crabbiest one – we share them both equally. “Over the past three days they’ve fallen into a great routine where they’re feeding every three hours and sleeping at the same time.  “So me and Zoe have started to get more rest.” Holly was able to be at Elijah’s birth, while she was still heavily pregnant with Olivia. But when it was her turn to give birth, a medical condition and being induced at short notice meant she ended up doing it alone. She said: “Being at Zoe’s elective C-section was great and it all ran smoothly. It also meant I had  days to really bond with Elijah before Olivia came along. I cherished that time. “I was induced a week early, ­because I had obstetric cholestasis, a liver condition which can cause foetal distress. Once I was induced, my waters broke quickly and it all went much faster than we were expecting.  “My dad was meant to be my birthing partner, because Zoe had just had the C-section so she wasn’t allowed in the hospital because of Covid. But he didn’t make it in time.” Luckily, all went well and the ­siblings were introduced to each other later that day. Holly – who like Zoe is now a full-time mum – went on: “There was an instant bond, they lay together staring at each other and touching each other’s faces. “Now they look for each other when they’re apart and they sleep in the same room. “They’ll share a cot when they’re old enough and can top and tail. I hope they grow up with the strongest bond. “Elijah can look out for his little sister and protect her, no one needs to know he’s only  days older. “Elijah was lb oz, while Olivia was lb oz, so he’s bigger – but they were both the same . They look like each other. They both have dark hair and blue eyes. You can tell they’re siblings – they’re adorable.”  Zoe’s daughter Shannon is loving being a big sister. Holly said: “They are very cuddly babies, so Shannon is making the most of all the cuddles. She lets them hold her finger with their tiny hands. “They’ve already got such a lovely bond. She’s a great big sister.” Zoe said: “I’m so glad the pregnancies are over and everything is fine. We have everything we wanted.” And Holly added: “Christmas this year will be brilliant! We’ll be enjoying the fact we’ve finally got the family we’ve waited so long for.” Comment MORE ON HospitalsPregnancyGiving birthMiscarriageTwinsSperm donationFertilityChristmas partySunday People" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man stuffed ex girlfriend suitcase
story: Man stuffed ex-girlfriend into suitcase ALIVE - and then left her to dieJavier Da Silva Rojas stuffed his ex-girlfriend Valerie Reyes into a small red suitcase and then left her to suffocate by the side of a road in Greenwich, ConnecticutValerie Reyes ended her relationship with Javier Da Silva Rojas after three months Image: YOUTUBEByGail Shortland:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsWorking at a bookstore in Eastchester, New York, meant that every day Valerie Reyes was surrounded by her favourite things – books. The -year-old loved to read in coffee shops and would go hiking on local nature trails to escape the noise of the city. But she also liked to spend Sundays with her family, catching up with her siblings and her mum. Valerie dreamt of becoming a tattoo artist and drew portraits for friends in the hope of one day opening her own parlour. Being creative also helped her as she struggled with depression. But despite her own problems, she always put other people first. In January  she met Javier Da Silva Rojas online. Rojas, an immigrant with joint Venezuelan and Portuguese citizenship, lived in Queens. He claimed to have fled political and economic turmoil the previous year, heading to the United States in search of a better le.  Compassionate Valerie would no doubt have had sympathy for him. She was noted for being hard-working and strove to make a good le for herself. Rojas worked in a restaurant but, unknown to most of the people around him, he was in the country illegally as his visa had expired. The couple started dating, but it was a short-lived association. Valerie’s family said “stubborn” Rojas was more interested in the relationship than she was, which led to tensions. Valerie ended the affair after three months and stopped all communication with him. He tried to keep talking to her but she refused. It was a chapter she wanted to put behind her. On  January , Valerie was reported missing after failing to turn up for work. She hadn’t been seen for two days and concern was growing. Her mother, Norma Sanchez, claimed that when she had last spoken to her daughter on the phone, she’d said she feared somebody was going to kill her. Valerie wouldn’t say why she believed this, but she was clearly frightened and was suffering anxiety attacks. Norma tried to push for details. Had someone been to her place  Had she been threatened  But Valerie wouldn’t reveal any more. Norma intended to follow it up during a shopping trip with her daughter. But when Valerie didn’t show, Norma assumed she’d changed her mind about meeting her. Then on  February, Valerie’s dead body was discovered by a group of highway workers in Greenwich, Connecticut, about  miles from her home. In a wooded area, about ft from the road, they spotted a red suitcase. The body was inside it.  Valerie’s legs and arms had been bound with duct tape and twine before she was stuffed into the suitcase. Several layers of tape had been placed over her mouth and there was evidence of a head wound and bruising to her face. It was a devastating discovery for Valerie’s family. A coroner determined that she had died from asphyxiation. A week later, it was revealed that someone had been using her bank card to withdraw money from her account. Surveillance footage showed a man wearing a black hoodie. He was in a rental vehicle that was traced to the man who hired it – Javier Da Silva Rojas. After he was arrested, police found that his DNA matched that on the suitcase handle and under Valerie’s fingernails. When questioned, Rojas admitted he’d visited her on the night of  January. Despite the fact they hadn’t been together for nine months, he claimed they’d had “rough sex”, during which Valerie had fallen and hit her head. He’d panicked and bound her in duct tape before shoving her in the suitcase and dumping it.  Investigators didn’t believe his story. If it was an accident, why hadn’t he simply called an ambulance  Valerie didn’t die from the head wound – she’d died from being suffocated. A consequence of his actions. Rojas had gone to Valerie’s apartment in a hire car. Before entering, he’d turned his mobile phone to aeroplane mode and switched off the location setting, suggesting he was covering his tracks from the start. Inside, the pair had a violent altercation that resulted in Valerie suffering a blow to the head. She was still alive when he bound and gagged her with duct tape and put her in the suitcase. He then put the case in the car and drove it to the dumping ground in Greenwich, where he tossed it into the wooded area not knowing whether Valerie was dead or alive. He also threw her phone away before starting to steal her money. In the hours after her death, Rojas began to withdrew cash from her account. A total of , was eventually taken. He also sold her iPad. These weren’t the acts of someone trying to cover up an accident – he was concealing a crime.  Rojas, , was charged with kidnapping resulting in death and in February  pleaded guilty at a court in White Plains, New York. Under a plea deal, which meant he avoided a le term or the death penalty, he was sentenced to  years in prison followed by two years supervised release. He will probably be deported afterwards. The court heard of the call Valerie made to her mother the day before her death, when she said she feared she would be killed. Although she hadn’t given any more details, she had clearly been scared. What had Rojas done to make her so sure she was going to die  During his sentencing in September this year, members of her family wore badges bearing her picture. While the prosecution contended that Rojas committed a “horric kidnapping” that resulted in Valerie’s death, his lawyer maintained he felt remorse for his crime. But it was pointed out that while Valerie’s family were desperately trying to find her, he had been stealing her money and trying to cover up evidence of his deed.  In a statement in court, her mother said, “You, Javier, deserve nothing but pain and rejection. I want you to hear the words of a mother who you devastated by taking away my baby girl.” She wept as she described the joy Valerie had brought to others and described her daughter’s killer as a “worthless soul”. In tears, Rojas responded, “No words can express how repulsed I am by the acts I committed. I will never forgive myself for that. I cannot ask [her family] to forgive me because I don’t deserve it. I would like them to know I’m very sorry.”The judge told Rojas, “What you did to this woman was sickening. Anyone who could do such a thing is not a good person, by definition. Anyone who can do a thing like that is an evil person. Justice requires an evil deed be punishedby a y prison sentence.”It remains unclear why Rojas killed Valerie, but her final moments were unthinkable. title: deaf dad awe one year
story: Deaf dad in awe as one-year-old tries interpreting for him for the first timeZachary was out shopping with his we and daughter when the tot attempted to communicate with him using sign language. He shared the moment on TikTok, where it has gone viralShe signed for the first time Image: oursignedworld TIKTOKByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Nov | commentsA dad who is deaf has shared the incredible moment his toddler attempted to sign to him for the very first time.Zachary, who goes under the username @oursignedworld on TikTok, was blown away when his one-year-old daughter Madison used sign language to communicate with him that there was a baby crying.I’m deaf and my daughter is hearing. This is the first time she tried interpreting for me he captioned the video. In the clip, he and Madison are walking through the supermarket when she suddenly drops what sheaposs holding so she can sign to her dad that she can hear a baby crying, before pointing in the direction.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Zach then repeated the gesture to her, asking: Baby crying  as she crouched down to pick up the washing-up sponges. She dropped what was in her hands, signed baby crying and pointed! This was a WOW moment, the video caption read. Since being posted, the clip has racked up more than . million views, with thousands of viewers cooing over the heartwarming moment. One person said: Wow! She not only signed what she was hearing she recognised that you couldnapost hear it also. Incredible.  Another wrote: Smart little girl. Sheaposs learning two languages together, connecting the two languages as she interacts in her world. Super toddler! This is truly one of the most amazing things I’ve ever seen, said a third. Others were amused by Madisonaposs priorities, with many joking that she was gossiping about the other shoppers, as one person said: Sheaposs GOSSIPING. Not her serving the tea via ASL [American Sign Language], added another.  Zach and his we Courtney, who is also hearing, are teaching their daughter how to speak and use sign language simultaneously.We use sign language to communicate as a family, but Madison and I also use spoken English, Courtney explained on their YouTube channel. Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news man-makes-gourmet-meals-puppy-"TikTok user prepares a gourmet meal for his dogByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Nov | commentsA professional chef has gone viral on TikTok after sharing the luxurious meals he creates for his puppy, including lobster rolls and wagyu steak. Sean MacDonald, , a chef from Toronto, Canada, lives with his -month-old puppy, Hazelnut – who eats better than most humans. The doting dog owner spends a few thousands of pounds on his pooch every year, feeding her meals that have TikTok users drooling. His fantastic dishes such as foie gras, puppy-friendly sushi and rack of lamb have seen the chef rack up . million likes for his videos, as well as , dedicated followers. Hazelnutaposs first-ever human-inspired meal was a plate of A wagyu ribeye steak, pea puree and carrots.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. I spent a lot on the first wagyu meal - but she’s my baby and she comes first before me, Sean said. I think her most luxurious meal has recently been beef with foie gras, bone marrow, truffle and lobster. I research everything before I feed it to her and I make sure it’s safe for dogs. These are all treat meals and I feed her a well-balanced diet of raw meat, vegetables and high-quality dog food. Sean later uploaded the dish to TikTok where, overnight, the video gained up over , views. Sean first became interested in cooking when he was just  but didn’t start his career as a chef until five years later. He said: I would help my mum with making dinner and I would always look forward to meals more than anything . I enrolled in a culinary school and travelled around the world, working under dferent chefs and was very studious with cookbooks. The process of making the food and putting care and attention to detail throughout is what I love the most. Overwhelmed but thrilled with the reaction from people on TikTok, he continued to post more videos, with their most popular attracting . million views and over , likes. In the clip, a tiny Hazelnut wags her tail and licks her lips, excited at the thought of her gourmet meal to come. The dish comprises poached prawns and celery, covered in a broth made from prawn shells, roasted celery and peanut.  Hazelnut is clearly a fan, happily lapping up every last bit. One person commented: Ok I understand the point of this video is you making your dog good food, but I would genuinely die for her. Another wrote: Your dog eating better than me. Meanwhile I give my dog two extra treats and his poops are weird for days, said a third. I just ate a crunch wrap supreme and your dog is eating Michelin star quality food, someone  commented.  Despite receiving a few negative comments, Hazelnut has built a loyal following and has even been puppy-spotted in real le, while out on daily walks. Sean added: People will stop us in the street and say, ‘Is that baby puppy Hazelnut ’ and I’ve had people yell from car windows and others who have named their puppies after her. I started to do this frequently because I realised how much people enjoyed watching them and it was more toward posting something positive and fun for people to watch during Covid. If we could make someone smile, we were doing something good and she’s grown up to be a very happy and healthy pup.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news model-snaps-selfie-beach-accidentally-"TikTok model catches elderly woman taking sneaky photoByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Nov | commentsA model was left baffled after she accidentally captured the moment an “elderly woman” snapped a sneaky picture of her while she was sunbathing on the beach. Eliza Rose Watson, , from the UK, was lounging on the beach in Crete during a recent holiday when she decided to take a selfie to send to a friend. When she zoomed in, she noticed someone lurking in the background of the image – a woman who appeared to have her phone pointed in Eliza Rose’s direction. But she didn’t take the incident to heart as she joked that her unlikely fan might have gotten a better angle of her bottom.Eliza Rose shared the picture on TikTok @elizarosewatsonwith her , followers, where she wrote: I mean, fair play to her. Has she got a better angle  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The post was viewed more than , times and racked up over , likes, with viewers left in hysterics over the apparent blunder, calling the woman out for being “sneaky.” One person said: “She deffo got a close up there.” Another wrote:: “Yea just texting…”  “Lol busted,” said someone . “There wasn’t much to do apart from laugh,” Eliza Rose said. “I respected her confidence and sense of apathy towards the situation. “My brain likes to think she saw an innocent woman getting her tan on but she, more likely, would have been giving me a virtual middle finger to the way ‘kids’ act today.  “I felt like my space was a little bit invaded, however, she was within her rights to take the photo or film. “After realising what had happened, I actually wanted to track her down because she probably got a better photo than me!” Eliza Rose says she has had similar incidents happen before – but usually with members of the opposite sex, as opposed to “elderly women”.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: british special forces ready deploy
story: Exclusive: British special forces ready to deploy  troops to Ukraine amid Russia invasion fearsBritish task force of SAS and Paras set to mobilise to Ukraine as MI warns the prime minister that President Putin could be a threat to Ukraine and the westThe RAF intercept a Russian bomber Image: PAByDan WarburtonReporter for the Sunday Mirror and People:,  Nov | commentsA task force of up to  UK troops is ready to deploy in Ukraine amid fears Russia is poised to invade its neighbour. Units from the SAS and Parachute Regiment have been warned they could be sent to the country within hours. The preparation comes after defence chiefs and the head of MI advised No that Russian President Vladimir Putin represents a clear and present danger to Ukraine and the West. Video footage that emerged appears to show Russian tanks, armoured vehicles and troops massing near Ukraine. Now a British force – consisting of SAS members, the Special Reconnaissance Regiment, medics, engineers, signallers and up to  paratroopers from  Air Assault Brigade based in Aldershot, Hants – is being set up.  A source said: “The high readiness element of the brigade was told it may need to deploy at very short notice. “Between  and  troops are ready. Their equipment is packed and they are ready to fly to Ukraine and either land or parachute in. They have trained for both eventualities.” Britain’s most senior military officer, General Sir Nick Carter, warned that there is a greater risk of accidental war erupting between the West and Russia than at any time since the Cold War. General Carter, Chief of the Defence Staff, said: “We have to be careful that people don’t end up allowing the bellicose nature of some of our politics to finish in a position where escalation leads to miscalculation.”  Tensions have been rising in eastern Europe after the EU accused Belarus of flying in thousands of migrants to engineer a humanitarian crisis on its border with Poland, a dispute that threatens to draw in Russia and Nato. Putin warned that unscheduled Nato drills in the Black Sea posed a serious challenge for Moscow and that Russia had nothing to do with the crisis on ally Belarus’ border with the bloc. US officials have alerted European allies about a possible attack, which would be the culmination of a long-running Kremlin feud with Ukraine. Russian officials insisted their troops were only sent to the border in response to the increased Nato border activity.  Senior British defence sources said hundreds of paras supported by artillery units could drop into the region within  hours of the green light. Footage on social media appears to show huge amounts of Russian military gear near the city of Voronezh,  miles east of the Ukrainian border. A large number of Russian tanks, howitzers and armoured vehicles were reported to have been moved there. The Kremlin has said the West was “playing with fire” by deploying warships and spy planes in the Black Sea. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has reassured Ukraine of Washington’s “ironclad” commitment to its security. The Ministry of Defence said: “The UK and our allies are unwavering in support for Ukraine’s sovereignty.” On Friday, the RAF said its Typhoons escorted two Russian Tu Blackjack bombers away from a ‘UK area of interest’ over the North Sea. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists.
